arm_group.description: the diabetic retinopathy patient in the SMS group will receive a SMS reminder message about the revisit time,address 1 week and 1 day before the appointment.
the diabetic retinopathy patient in the control group won't get any reminder message before the appointment.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to use a randomized controlled design to determine the impact
      of a SMS messaging intervention on the following outcomes among persons diagnosed with
      diabetic retinopathy in rural China.

clinical_study.brief_title: a Trial of Using SMS Reminder Among Diabetic Retinopathy Patients in Rural China

detailed_description.textblock:
SMS message reminder is a system which can sent re-visit information to remind the patient
      about the revisit time and address. The investigators can use the SMS system to find out if
      it is a useful to reduce the not-attended rate of the revisit appointment among the rural
      diabetic retinopathy patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        - all the diabetes patients who would like to join our study in 10 CREST cooperated rural
        hospitals.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Both the patient and his/her caretakers don't have cellphone,or the one who has
             cellphone but don't know how to use the SMS function.

          2. The first re-visit appointment time is outside our study period.

intervention.description: the SMS reminder message will sent to the SMS group patients 1 week and 1 day before there appointment,to remind them the exact time and address of the revisit appointment.

facility.name: Blindness Preventment and Treatment Department, Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center

clinical_study.official_title: a Randomized Controlled Trail to Determine the Impact of a SMS Reminder Among Diabetic Retinopathy Patients in Rural China

overall_official.affiliation: Blindness Prevention and Treament Department,Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center

primary_outcome.description: Compare the SMS patient not-attended rate with the control group to show the impact of SMS reminder on the compliance with scheduled follow-up visit

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: vice director,Blindness Prevention and Treatment Department

secondary_outcome.description: Using a questionnaire about the comprehensive eye exam and Diabetic retinopathy to compare Knowledge about Diabetic retinopathy on a standardized examination  between the SMS group and the control group
secondary_outcome.measure: Knowledge about Diabetic retinopathy on a standardized examination

secondary_outcome.description: Presenting vision in the better-seeing and worse-seeing eyes of the two group
Loss of two or more lines of presenting vision in better-seeing eye  thought due to Diabetic retinopathy
Using a patient satisfaction questionnaire to compare satisfaction with care between the SMS group and the control group
Compare Number of treatment received for Diabetic retinopathy between the SMS group and the control group to show if the SMS reminder increase the number of treatments
secondary_outcome.measure: Number of treatments received for Diabetic retinopathy

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
